glossary.definition: Physical or software device used to record employee time entries
Link between a device and employees authorized to use it
Process of syncing time records from device to central system
Current operational state of a device (online, offline, error, maintenance)

business_rules: Devices must be registered before use
Employees must be associated with devices to record time
Device synchronization occurs on schedule or on-demand
Device status is monitored and alerts are sent on errors
Time records from devices are validated before being accepted
Employees can be associated with multiple devices
Device errors trigger alerts and may require manual intervention
Device data is encrypted in transit and at rest
Device associations can be temporary or permanent
calculations_or_formulas: Records per device = count of time records from device in period
invariants: Employee-device association must be valid and active
Device synchronization must maintain data integrity
Device status must be tracked and updated
Time records from devices must include device ID
edge_cases: Device goes offline during sync - system queues records, syncs when device comes online
Employee uses unassigned device - system rejects record or flags for review
Device synchronization fails - system retries, logs error, alerts administrator
Device firmware update required - system schedules maintenance, prevents records during update
Multiple devices record same employee at same time - system validates, may flag duplicate
Device is replaced - system migrates associations, archives old device data
Device battery dies - system detects offline status, alerts for maintenance
Network connectivity issues - device queues records locally, syncs when connection restored
compliance_requirements: Device data must be encrypted in transit and at rest
Device access must be logged for security auditing
Device failures must be documented and reported
Device data retention must comply with legal requirements
Device security must meet company standards
user_journeys: Admin registers new time clock device - device is registered, configured, available for associations
Admin associates employee with device - association is created, employee can use device
Device synchronizes time records - records are retrieved, validated, imported to system
Device goes offline - system detects offline status, alerts administrator, queues records
Employee uses device to check in - record is created on device, synced to system, validated
Admin replaces device - old device is archived, new device is registered, associations are migrated
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given device registration, when device information is provided, then device is registered and available for associations
Given employee-device association, when employee and device are valid, then association is created and employee can use device
Given device synchronization, when device is online, then records are retrieved and imported to system
Given device offline, when device status changes to offline, then system alerts administrator and queues records
Given device replacement, when new device is registered, then old device is archived and associations are migrated
open_questions: What device types are supported? (physical time clocks? mobile apps? biometric?)
How frequently does device synchronization occur? (real-time? scheduled? on-demand?)
What happens when device data conflicts with system data? (device wins? system wins? manual resolution?)
How are device firmware updates handled? (automatic? manual? scheduled maintenance?)
What security measures are required for devices? (encryption? authentication? access control?)
How are device errors handled? (automatic retry? manual intervention? escalation?)
assumptions: Devices communicate with central system via network (wired or wireless)
Device synchronization can be scheduled or triggered on-demand
Employee-device associations can be temporary or permanent
Device status is monitored and updated regularly
Device data is encrypted for security
